paper_abstract: The edge-Wiener index of a graph G is defined as the Wiener index of the line graph of G. In this paper an algorithm is developed that, for a given benzenoid system G with m edges, computes the edge-Wiener index of G in O(m) time. The key to the algorithm is a reduction of the problem to three different weighted trees. In addition to the previously used weighted vertex- and edge-Wiener indices, the so-called weighted vertex-edge-Wiener index is introduced and essentially used in the algorithm.
paper_title: The Edge-Wiener Index of Benzenoid Systems in Linear Time
